item.title: 股市音乐之王的兴衰史
item.description:
Merck Mercuriadis 让从歌星到黑石（Blackstone）的所有人都相信，音乐是下一个热门资产类别。除了他，所有人都成功了。【原文：

Merck Mercuriadis convinced everyone from pop stars to Blackstone that music was the next hot asset class. It worked out for everyone—but him.

】

item.title: 美国基金支持的 ESR 寻求以 20% 的折扣出售中国办公楼
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，华平投资（Warburg Pincus）支持的 ESR 集团有限公司（ESR Group Ltd.）旗下的 ARA 资产管理有限公司（ARA Asset Management Ltd.）将以约 23 亿元人民币（约合 3.14 亿美元）的价格出售上海的一座高档写字楼。【原文：ARA Asset Management Ltd., a unit of Warburg Pincus-backed ESR Group Ltd., is offering to sell a premium office tower in Shanghai for about 2.3 billion yuan ($314 million), people familiar with the matter said, as companies look for a way out of China’s troubled economy and property market crisis.】

item.title: 中国对会谈持开放态度，如果美国表示尊重，并任命联系人
item.description: 据一位熟悉中国政府想法的人士透露，中国希望看到唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府在同意贸易谈判之前采取一系列措施，包括收敛其内阁成员的诋毁性言论，从而表现出更多的尊重。【原文：China wants to see a number of steps from President Donald Trump’s administration before it will agree to trade talks, including showing more respect by reining in disparaging remarks by members of his cabinet, according to a person familiar with the Chinese government’s thinking.】

item.title: 日美贸易谈判有可能进一步加剧日元波动
item.description: 在日本首席贸易谈判代表赤泽亮世前往美国启动贸易谈判之际，他面临着被迫讨论货币的风险，这种情况可能会进一步加剧日元的波动。【原文：As Japan’s chief trade negotiator Ryosei Akazawa heads to the US to kick off trade talks, he faces the risk of being forced to discuss currencies more than he wants, a scenario that may add further volatility to the yen.】

item.title: 加密货币公司 OKX 在与司法部和解后推出美国交易所
item.description: 加密货币交易所 OKX 在同意支付 5 亿美元以解决当地政府提出的指控后仅几周，就开始在美国扩张业务。【原文：Crypto exchange OKX is expanding in the US just weeks after agreeing to pay half a billion dollars to settle charges brought by local authorities.】

item.title: 账户遭黑客攻击后，日本经纪商将加强身份验证
item.description: 日本证券行业组织正敦促经纪商在发生一系列导致未经授权的股票交易的黑客攻击事件后，加强对客户账户身份验证的要求。【原文：Japan’s securities industry group is urging brokerages to tighten identification requirements for client accounts following a spate of hacking incidents that led to unauthorized stock trading.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦可能提出购买更多棉花和大豆以安抚特朗普
item.description: 据知情人士透露，巴基斯坦将提议从美国购买更多棉花和大豆，因为巴基斯坦希望将双边贸易顺差减半，并逃避美国总统唐纳德-特朗普征收的关税。【原文：Pakistan will offer to buy more cotton and soybean from the US, according to people with knowledge of the matter, as it looks to halve its bilateral trade surplus and escape tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 沙特企业不受市场波动影响，继续推进首次公开募股计划
item.description: 尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税政策助长了全球市场的波动，但这一迹象表明，迄今为止，沙特王国的交易渠道仍在继续。【原文：Saudi Arabia is set to see a slew of companies test investor appetite for initial public offerings over the coming weeks, a sign that the kingdom’s deal pipeline is holding up so far despite the global market volatility fueled by US President Donald Trump’s tariffs.】

item.title: 意大利在 S&P 评级上调后测试投资者对债券的需求
item.description: 自上周 S&P 全球评级公司（S&P Global Ratings）提升其信用评级以来，意大利共和国首次进入银团债券市场，以寻求利用投资者情绪的改善和更加稳定的市场背景。【原文：The Republic of Italy is coming to the syndicated bond market for the first time since S&P Global Ratings lifted its credit rating last week as it seeks to capitalize on improved investor sentiment and a more stable market backdrop.】

item.title: 习近平出访马来西亚推动中国投资促进两国关系发展
item.description: 国家主席习近平表示，他鼓励中国公司到马来西亚投资和创业，这是他推动深化东南亚关系以应对美国不断增加的压力的一部分。【原文：President Xi Jinping said he encourages Chinese companies to invest and start businesses in Malaysia, as part of his push to deepen ties in Southeast Asia to counter mounting pressure from the US.】

item.title: 英伟达受限打击市场情绪，欧洲股市下跌；ASML下跌
item.description: 美国政府限制芯片制造商英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.ASML Holding NV 因第一季度订单不佳下跌了 7.6%。【原文：European equities retreated as the US administration’s restrictions on chipmaker Nvidia Corp.’s exports to China hurt investor sentiment. ASML Holding NV dropped as much as 7.6% on first-quarter orders miss.】

item.title: 资产公司吸引澳大利亚富人贷款以取代 AT1 债券
item.description: 在澳大利亚上市的投资公司收益资产管理有限公司（Income Asset Management Ltd.）正在推出所谓的管理账户，让当地富人直接投资于企业贷款，以取代即将被废除的或有可转换证券。【原文：Australia-listed investment firm Income Asset Management Ltd. is launching so-called managed accounts for wealthy locals to invest directly in corporate loans to replace the soon-to-be scrapped contingent convertible securities.】

item.title: 澳大利亚社交媒体禁令保证豁免 YouTube
item.description: 根据信息自由法获得的文件显示，澳大利亚通信部长米歇尔-罗兰（Michelle Rowland）向 YouTube 全球负责人作出个人保证，YouTube 平台将免受该国针对 16 岁以下青少年的社交媒体禁令的限制，甚至在就特别例外条款进行正式磋商之前就已如此。【原文：Australian Communications Minister Michelle Rowland gave a personal guarantee to the global head of YouTube that the platform would be exempt from the country’s social-media ban for under-16s, even before an official consultation process on the special carveout, according to documents obtained under freedom-of-information laws.】

item.title: 阿布扎比 M42 投资长寿初创公司 Juvenescence
item.description: 阿布扎比国家支持的医疗保健投资公司 M42 已入股生物技术初创公司 Juvenescence，该公司总部位于英国，致力于开发延长人类寿命的药物。【原文：Abu Dhabi’s state-backed health-care investment company M42 has taken a stake in biotech startup Juvenescence, a UK-based firm focused on developing drugs to expand human lifespans.】

item.title: 特姆和申公司在小包裹关税前看到美国销售额激增
item.description: 由于美国购物者在关税导致的价格上涨到来之前囤积了化妆刷和家用电器等产品，网购巨头特姆和Shein的销售额在3月和4月出现反弹。【原文：Online shopping giants Temu and Shein saw their sales rebound in March and April as US shoppers stockpiled products like makeup brushes and home appliances before tariff-led price increases set in.】

item.title: 贸易战担忧重创美国资产，美元再度走软
item.description: 由于对贸易战扩大的担忧抑制了对美国资产的需求，衡量美元汇率的指标在短暂的缓和之后又恢复了跌势。【原文：A gauge of the dollar resumed declines following a short-lived reprieve as concerns over an expanding trade war dented demand for US assets.】

item.title: 中国正在利用七种稀土金属对付美国
item.description: 从战斗机到核反应堆棒和智能手机，稀土矿物对各种产品都至关重要。随着地缘政治和贸易紧张局势的加剧，中国在采矿和加工领域的主导地位意味着这些小众金属已成为对抗对手的利器。【原文：From fighter planes to nuclear reactor rods and smartphones, rare earth minerals are vital to a wide array of products. As geopolitical and trade tensions rise, China’s dominance of both mining and processing means these niche metals have become a cudgel to use against opponents.】

item.title: 英国通胀率在家庭账单冲击前有所缓解
item.description: 英国通胀率连续第二个月回落，在本月家庭账单大幅增加之前为他们提供了一些宽慰。【原文：UK inflation slipped back for a second straight month, providing some relief for households before they were hit by a huge increase in bills this month.】

item.title: ASML 业绩不佳，Nvidia 受限，日本芯片股跌势加剧
item.description: 半导体材料制造商 ASML Holding NV 第一季度订单不及预期，加剧了市场对该行业前景的担忧，日本芯片设备公司股价跌幅加深。【原文：Shares of Japanese chip equipment firms deepened their decline after semiconductor material maker ASML Holding NV’s first-quarter orders missed estimates, fueling worries about the outlook for the sector.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英镑创七月以来最长连胜纪录
中美关税战升级，中国任命新贸易特使
item.description: 中国更换了贸易代表，因为北京和华盛顿在为不断升级的贸易战降温的谈判条件问题上仍然僵持不下。【原文：China replaced its trade representative as Beijing and Washington remain at an impasse over the conditions for talks to cool the escalating trade war.】

item.title: 美国关税不确定性逼近 ASML 订单不及预期
item.description: ASML Holding NV 报告订单低于预期，原因是在美国关税威胁颠覆该行业之前，芯片行业在本季度表现疲软。【原文：ASML Holding NV reported lower-than-expected orders, citing weakness in the chip sector in the quarter before US tariffs threatened to upend the industry.】

item.title: 两名管理董事辞职后，矿产资源公司股价暴跌
item.description: 在两名负责公司治理的董事会成员辞职后，矿产资源有限公司股价下跌超过 7%。【原文：Mineral Resources Ltd. shares fell more than 7% after two board members overseeing corporate governance resigned.】

item.title: 尼日利亚南北分裂阻碍了蒂努布提高税收的努力
item.description: 尼日利亚总统博拉-蒂努布（Bola Tinubu）的经济改革议程中的一个关键部分遭到了议员们的反对，这暴露了尼日利亚较富裕的基督教南方和以穆斯林为主的北方之间长达一个世纪之久的国家政治裂痕。【原文：Nigeria’s President Bola Tinubu has seen a key part of his economic reform agenda rebuffed by lawmakers, exposing a century-old fracture in national politics between the country’s wealthier Christian south and predominantly Muslim north.】

item.title: Gensol 因印度监管机构发现资金挪用而延续跌势
item.description: 在印度市场监管部门初步调查发现 Gensol 工程有限公司创始人挪用资金后，该公司股价跌至近三年来的最低点。【原文：Shares of Gensol Engineering Ltd. fell to their lowest in nearly three years after an initial probe by Indian market regulator found a diversion of funds by its founders.】

item.title: 美国购物者因担心关税而涌向中国应用程序
item.description: 美国人正在中国的电子商务应用程序上寻找便宜的手提包、瑜伽裤和钱包，因为购物者担心本土平台会因关税而涨价。【原文：Americans are scouring Chinese e-commerce apps for cheap handbags, yoga pants and wallets as shoppers fear homegrown platforms will hike prices due to tariffs.】

item.title: 欧盟商业机构要求中国全面改革工业政策
item.description: 一个欧洲商业团体称，在唐纳德-特朗普的关税政策颠覆全球贸易体系之际，中国若想避免进一步的反弹并在国际上建立经济联系，就需要修改其工业政策。【原文：China needs to revise its industrial policies if it wants to avoid further backlash and build economic ties internationally as Donald Trump’s tariffs upend the global trade system, according to a European business group.】

item.title: 期权交易员押注欧元、日元兑美元将走高
item.description: 在上周美元大幅下跌之后，外汇交易商正在改变他们的期权策略，押注美元走软。【原文：Foreign-exchange traders are changing their options tactics for betting on a weaker dollar after the greenback’s large decline last week.】

item.title: 贸易战担忧加剧，中国股市在香港暴跌
item.description: 由于对中美贸易战扩大的担忧重燃，香港中资股将结束六日连涨。【原文：Chinese stocks in Hong Kong are set to snap a six-day winning streak, as renewed fears of an expanding US-China trade war weigh on sentiment.】

item.title: 欧洲市场正从 "美国优先 "贸易退潮中获益
item.description:
唐纳德-特朗普推动重塑全球贸易，促使投资者转向欧洲

。【原文：

Donald Trump's push to reshape global trade is driving investors to Europe

】
